summary: The implementation covers most of the core requirements including Internet Identity authentication, user profiles with creation and update capabilities, follow/unfollow system, post creation with up to 5 images, chronological news feed, likes, comments, user search, and a Facebook-like layout with blue and white theme. However, several features appear to be incomplete or missing based on the provided diff evidence.

missing_requirements.requirement: Implement chronological news feed showing posts exclusively from users that the current user follows
missing_requirements.reason: The backend shows 'getNewsFeed' returns all posts sorted by timestamp with no filtering logic based on follow relationships. Frontend uses this same feed for both the main feed and profile pages without filtering.

missing_requirements.requirement: Display followers count and following count on profile page
missing_requirements.reason: Profile page hardcodes follower and following counts to '0' instead of retrieving actual counts from the backend. No backend functions visible for getting these counts.

missing_requirements.requirement: Follow/unfollow actions update the UI immediately
missing_requirements.reason: FollowButton component hardcodes 'isFollowing={false}' on ProfilePage, meaning the UI does not reflect the actual follow state and cannot display the correct button state.

hallucinated_features.description: Theme switching capability with dark mode support
hallucinated_features.reason: The application includes ThemeProvider with dark mode styling throughout all components. This was not requested in any requirement or constraint.

hallucinated_features.description: Profile settings page with dedicated route
hallucinated_features.reason: A separate '/settings' route and ProfileSettingsPage component were created. REQ-3 only mentions profile photo updates from 'profile settings' but does not specify a separate settings page implementation.
